title: Brown Bears Recipe
description: These brown bears are campfire bread made from canned biscuit dough, butter, white sugar, and ground cinnamon. Both kids and grown-ups will love them.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Quick Bread Recipes Biscuits Brown Bears 4.7 (23) 19 Reviews 4 Photos My kids love making these brown bear biscuits for breakfast whenever we go camping. They're super simple and no prep for mom! Submitted by cookinmomma Updated on September 12, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup white sugar ¼ cup ground cinnamon ½ cup unsalted butter, melted 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated biscuit dough Directions Gather all ingredients. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn Mix sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl. Pour melted butter into another bowl. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn Separate biscuits; form each dough piece into a rope 4 to 5 inches long. Wrap dough pieces around skewers. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn Hold skewers over campfire; slowly turn until biscuit dough is browned and set, 8 to 10 minutes. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn Dip biscuits into melted butter, then into cinnamon-sugar. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the cinnamon-sugar and butter. The actual amount of the ingredients consumed will vary. I Made It Print 47 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 320 Calories 16g Fat 43g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 320 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 21% Saturated Fat 9g 43% Cholesterol 31mg 10% Sodium 432mg 19% Total Carbohydrate 43g 16% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 28g Protein 3g 5% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 56mg 4% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 76mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Brown Bears 01 of 04 Photo by  AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn 02 of 04 Photo by  Abbey 06/20/2024 Tasted great and very enjoyable to make! 03 of 04 Photo by  hutch 03/18/2020 04 of 04 Photo by  Tyr 03/18/2019 it was really good frfr—what I did was I coated the sticks in the butter and cinnamon-sugar when they were raw, then stuck em in the oven at the temperature recommended on the biscuit can for about 3-5 minutes less than directed. turned out perfect. 1 You’ll Also Love Holiday Breakfast Sandwiches 3 Ratings Monkey Bread Foil Packets Fresh Alberta Biscuits 2 Ratings Mom's Baking Powder Biscuits 344 Ratings Honey Biscuits 5 Ratings Butter Dips 4 Ratings Cinnamon Sweet Puffs 13 Ratings Blueberry Lemon Breakfast Biscuits 19 Ratings 7-Up Biscuits 111 Ratings 10+ Light, Flaky, and Fluffy Rolled Biscuit Recipes Strawberry Rhubarb Drop Biscuits 6 Ratings Whole Wheat Sourdough Biscuits 1 Rating Fluffy Sour Cream Biscuits 36 Ratings Basic Biscuits 1,213 Ratings Buttered Biscuits 190 Ratings Monkey Bread Kabobs 18 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn;Separate biscuits; form each dough piece into a rope 4 to 5 inches long. Wrap dough pieces around skewers. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn;Hold skewers over campfire; slowly turn until biscuit dough is browned and set, 8 to 10 minutes. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn;Dip biscuits into melted butter, then into cinnamon-sugar. AllRecipes / Abbey Littlejohn
